definition: stick/pole/lever/classifier for long objects such as guns

sentences.english: I have been a hard-core meat eater all my life.
sentences.chinese: 我這輩子一直是鐵桿肉食者。

sentences.english: Neither, I am a big fan of Argentina. What is your favorite team?
sentences.chinese: 兩個都不支持，我是阿根廷隊的鐵桿球迷，你呢？

sentences.english: Sure, they’re b.f.f.s, but we always thought
sentences.chinese: 當然，她倆是鐵桿老友，但大家都認爲。

sentences.english: As a hard-core film geek, I've seen plenty of sci-fi posers.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一個鐵桿電影迷，我看到過很多科幻影片。

sentences.english: He soon became a reliable true-blue country club conservative.
sentences.chinese: 他不久就成了保守黨鄉村俱樂部忠誠的鐵桿成員。

sentences.english: The prophet Lehi compared the word of God to an iron rod.
sentences.chinese: 先知李海把神的話比喻成鐵桿。

sentences.english: Some even carry four wedges, depending on the course they are playing.
sentences.chinese: 根據球場的情況，有些人甚至會帶四支短鐵桿。

sentences.english: Well, I know you are a huge basketball fan. This lockout, this is really depressing.
sentences.chinese: 好的，您是鐵桿籃球迷，這次停擺肯定讓您鬱悶吧。

sentences.english: I heard you are a die-hard soccer fan.
sentences.chinese: 我聽說你是個鐵桿球迷。

sentences.english: We hope to be able to change the regulations despite a hard core of objectors.
sentences.chinese: 儘管有一羣鐵桿反對者，我們希望能夠修改規定。

sentences.english: One of them is used each iron rod at the end of the multi-functional design.
sentences.chinese: 其中之一是每支鐵桿都採用了多功能杆底設計。

sentences.english: Especially its " iron lever " lionet A Lin.
sentences.chinese: 尤其是它的“鐵桿”小獅子阿林。
白令是一位鐵桿無神論者。

sentences.english: One of them is iron each have adopted a multi-functional sole design.
sentences.chinese: 其中之一是每支鐵桿都採用了多功能杆底設計。

sentences.english: Are you a big Lamborghini fan?
sentences.chinese: 你是蘭博基尼的鐵桿嗎？

sentences.english: He cut the iron pole to the size he wanted.
sentences.chinese: 他把鐵桿鋸成他需要的尺寸。

definition: to give a thumbs-up/to express one's approval
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
Tiger Balm (medicine)/jack of all trades (and master of none)(slang)
overwhelmed by favor from superior (humble expr.)
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
